conclusion: Read p-V coordinates: State A: p_A = 3 × 10⁵ Pa, V_A = 2 × 10⁻³ m³; State B: p_B = 2 × 10⁵ Pa, V_B = 2 × 10⁻³ m³; State C: p_C = 2 × 10⁵ Pa, V_C = 3 × 10⁻³ m³
Use the ideal-gas relation pV = nRT
Determine nR from state A using T_A = 27 °C = 300 K, resulting in nR = 2.0 J K⁻¹
Apply nR to state C and solve for T_C, resulting in T_C = 300 K
Convert T_C from Kelvin to Celsius: T_C = 27 °C
The temperature of the gas in state C is 27 °C
